snippet: Rory Staunton always aimed for the stars. Before a strep infection, discovered too late, cut his life short, the 12-year-old from Queens soared.
abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column expresses sadness and outrage at the death of Rory Staunton, a 12-year-old boy from Queens who died of septic shock after falling down at a school gym; describes the incompetent care he received at NYU Langone Medical Center, amid a perfect storm of false assumptions, overlooked data and overburdened doctors.
lead_paragraph: Rory Staunton always aimed for the stars. Before a strep infection, discovered too late, cut his life short, the 12-year-old from Queens soared.

headline.print_headline: The Boy Who Wanted to Fly
